    level="1"
    right="Weapon 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Repeating Hand Crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=449)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Repeating" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=374" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 64 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Pathfinder #165: Eyes of Empty Death](/Sources.aspx?ID=81) pg. 73

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 10 gp

**Damage** 1d6 P

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

**Range** 60 ft.

**Reload** 0
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Ranged

**Category** Advanced

**Group** [Crossbow](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=17)
</row>

**Ammunition** [Repeating Hand Crossbow Magazine](/Weapons.aspx?ID=182)

</column>

---

This handheld crossbow features an ingeniously designed catch mechanism at the top of the flight groove, just in front of the latch, which automatically loads a bolt from a magazine and resets the string each time the weapon is fired. A typical repeating hand crossbow magazine holds five bolts.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-17" />
